fs.polyglot.undo
Class UndoableVariantEdit

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
      fs.polyglot.undo.UndoableVariantEdit
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit
public class UndoableVariantEdit
extends javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit

This class represents a change to polyglotstring variant, i.e. an addition, a removal or a change of value.

Author:
Simon Hampe
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

UndoableVariantEdit

public UndoableVariantEdit(Variant oldValue,
                           Variant newValue,
                           PolyglotTableModel table,
                           PolyglotStringLoader loader,
                           java.lang.String languageID)
Creates an edit representing a change to a variant

Parameters:
oldValue - The old value. If null, this is considered a removal
newValue - The new value. If null, this is considered an addition. If both are null, this operation has no effect and if both are non-null, this operation is only valid, if both have the same string id and language id. In this case this edit represents a value change
table - The table in which to perform the changes. If this is null, the edit has no effect.
loader - The string loader for loading representation names. If null, the default loader is used
languageID - The language id for the representation names. If null, the global language id is used.
Method Detail

canRedo

public boolean canRedo()
Specified by:
canRedo in interface javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit
Overrides:
canRedo in class javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
Returns:
true, if and only if one of the following is true:
- Both values or the table are null
- This represents a removal or addition
- This represents a value change, both variants have the same string and language id, and the old variant exists in the table

canUndo

public boolean canUndo()
Specified by:
canUndo in interface javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit
Overrides:
canUndo in class javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit
Returns:
true, if and only if one of the following is true:
- Both values or the table are null
- This represents a removal or addition
- This represents a value change, both variants have the same string and language id, and the old variant exists in the table
